title: On Trial
description: On a crisp autumn morning in 1903, a young woman seeks employment in a fashionable London townhouse.

title: The Mistress and the Maids
description: Richard Bellamy engages an artist to paint a portrait of his beautiful wife, Lady Marjorie.

title: Board Wages
description: Matters get out of hand when the servants mock their employers while the family are away on a summer holiday.

title: The Path of Duty
description: Elizabeth returns from studying abroad and the household are in a frenzy, preparing for Elizabeth's entr√©e into London society.

title: A Suitable Marriage
description: Elizabeth decides not to marry Angus and is captivated by a German-baron visiting England at Christmas.

title: A Cry for Help
description: Richard's genuine concern for the new house parlormaid has eyebrows raised and tongues wagging.

title: Magic Casements
description: Her sense of duty and loyalty are severely compromised when Lady Marjorie has a passionate affair with a friend of James, with whom she falls deeply in love.

title: I Dies from Love
description: Upstairs, Lady Majorie and friends plan an outing for the servants. However, Downstairs there is romantic intrigue going on between Emily and the next door footman.

title: Why Is Her Door Locked?
description: Months after Emily's death, a grief-ridden Mrs. Bridges takes leave of her senses.

title: A Voice from the Past
description: In an effort to help the poor in London's East End, James and Elizabeth come face-to-face with a downtrodden Sarah .

title: The Swedish Tiger
description: James entertains a visiting Swedish friend and Sarah is the prime suspect when valuable household objects go missing.

title: The Key of the Door
description: On the eve of her 21st birthday, Elizabeth is utterly defiant and, consequently, on the brink of a complete breach with her parents.

title: For Love of Love
description: Despite their disdain for social conventions, Elizabeth marries Fabian socialist and poet, Lawrence Kirbridge, in a traditional church service and all of its trappings.

title: The New Man
description: Mr. and Mrs. Lawrence Kirbridge return from their honeymoon and set up their new household in nearby Greenwich.

title: A Pair of Exiles
description: Sarah tells James she's having his baby and the Bellamys make provisions to avoid a major scandal.

title: Married Love
description: The strained Kirbridge marriage has yet to be consummated, causing Elizabeth great unhappiness in her quest to make a happy life with Lawrence and her great desire to start a family. As it happens, Lawrence's interests lie elsewhere.

title: Whom God hath Joined...
description: When Elizabeth arrives at Eaton Place for tea, it becomes increasingly evident that she's left Lawrence after their six-month marriage.

title: Guest of Honour
description: Mrs. Bridges is the envy of every cook in Mayfair and Belgravia when His Majesty, King Edward VII dines at Eaton Place.

title: The Property of a Lady
description: A tangled web of duplicity is woven when love letters in Lady Marjorie's delicate hand fall into the tawdry hands of a scheming Irishman.

title: Your Obedient Servant
description: Richard and Hudson realize the complicated fraternal relationship when their respective brothers visit London.

title: Out of the Everywhere
description: Elizabeth returns home with her newborn daughter, Lucy, and the very disagreeable and old Nanny Webster, to look after "Baby".

title: An Object of Value
description: Everyone's nerves are frazzled when Lord Southwold dies, Lady Southwold and her companion, Miss Hodges, spend a some time with Richard and Lady Marjorie and a valuable diamond brooch goes missing.

title: A Special Mischief
description: Elizabeth joins the suffragette movement, but in her effort to protect her, Rose is imprisoned.

title: The Fruits of Love
description: Sweet pillow talk is very useful to Elizabeth's new lover, wealthy businessman Julius Karekin and Lady Marjorie and Richard are in the throes of losing their beloved Eaton Place.

title: The Wages of Sin
description: Sarah is pregnant with Watkins' baby and Lady Marjorie has run out of patience with both of them.

title: A Family Gathering
description: Elizabeth's affair with Julius is over, James returns to England with his fianc√©e, Phyllis, and a major event marks the end of an era.

title: Miss Forrest
description: In the spring of 1912, Lady Marjorie prepares to visit Elizabeth in New York and James takes an interest in Richard's comely and respectable new secretary, Miss Forrest.

title: A House Divided
description: News of the Titanic disaster arrives at Eaton Place, and the entire household anxiously await word of Lady Marjorie's fate.

title: A Change of Scene
description: James' weekend visit to Somerby Park, with Hudson in tow as his valet, presents an opportunity for both to appreciate their beloved Eaton Place and what they've left behind there.

title: A Family Secret
description: The race is on downstairs -- who will marry first upstairs -- Captain James or his father, Richard?

title: Rose's Pigeon
description: Alfred, the former Bellamy footman, is on the run and dupes Rose and uses her kindness as a shield from the law.

title: Desirous of Change
description: Hazel Bellamy assumes her role as mistress of the household with great trepidation and Richard becomes the quarry of a bounty-hunting Austrian woman and her wily and rapacious brother.

title: Word of Honour
description: Richard Bellamy, who has been in considerable financial distress since the death of Lady Marjorie, finds himself at the center of a insider trading firestorm in his capacity as a member of Parliament.

title: The Bolter
description: Hazel's first substantial encounter with fashionable society causes her great humiliation, marital distress and a near-fatal accident, when she and James visit Lord and Lady Newbury at Sommerby Park.

title: Goodwill to All Men
description: It's Christmas 1913 and two young ladies, one from upstairs and the new parlor maid, conspire to spread holiday cheer to the less fortunate.

title: What the Footman Saw
description: A leisurely evening out with his chums, a few beers and some downstairs gossip give Edward a bigger headache than any hangover ever could.

title: A Perfect Stranger
description: While running an ordinary errand, Rose's life takes an extraordinary turn.

title: Distant Thunder
description: The disparity between James' and Hazel's background is cut wide open when Hazel suffers a miscarriage.

title: The Sudden Storm
description: A downstairs dalliance and a happy outing to a seaside resort divert the staff as war looms on the European continent.

title: A Patriotic Offering
description: In a gesture of goodwill, the Bellamys offer generous hospitality to a family of Belgian refugees and Edward is feeling increased pressure to enlist.

title: News from the Front
description: James is home on leave and offers a realistic account of what is really happening on the front and Daisy and Edward announce their engagement to Hudson.

title: The Beastly Hun
description: The sinking of the Lusitania has Hudson on a tirade and his anti-German fervor pervade the servants hall. Upstairs, Richard is made Civil Lord of the Admiralty in the newly-formed coalition government.

title: Women Shall Not Weep
description: Edward and Daisy marry before he's sent to France and Georgina becomes a volunteer nurse.

title: Tug of War
description: James yearns for a regimental post at the front and Rose volunteers to become a conductorette as the war rages on.

title: Home Fires
description: Lady Prudence hijacks the Bellamy drawing room for an officers tea party and in her new job as conductress, Rose collects a fare from a very special passenger.

title: If You Were the Only Girl in the World
description: Hazel romances a shy pilot with mad abandon, James and Georgina meet in France on the eve of a major military campaign.

title: The Glorious Dead
description: Sadly, perhaps inevitably, tragic news arrives for someone at Eaton Place.

title: Another Year
description: At the end of a very difficult year, the New Year is full of hope and augurs well, especially for Richard Bellamy

title: The Hero's Farewell
description: Lady Prudence finally gets hold of the Bellamy drawing room for a worthy cause.

title: Missing Believed Killed
description: Their nerves in tatters, Hazel and Richard do all they can to unearth any information about James.

title: Facing Fearful Odds
description: Virginia Hamilton returns to Eaton Place, seeking Richard's advice on an urgent matter.

title: Peace out of Pain
description: While James is convalescing, Richard proposes to Mrs. Hamilton, Edward comes home, and Hazel comes down with the Spanish flu as the war draws to an end,

title: On with the Dance
description: It's June 1919 and a jubilant Victory Parade passes 165 Eaton Place -- but with the new family dynamic, what's to become of the beloved Bellamy townhouse?

title: A Place in the World
description: As Britain tries to rebound from the war, James Bellamy runs for political office.

title: Laugh a Little Louder Please
description: Georgina and her cohort throw a bacchanal at Eaton Place, with tragic consequences.

title: The Joy Ride
description: When James buys a small airplane, Virginia defies Richard and the three undergo quite an ordeal.

title: Wanted - a Good Home
description: It's the new governess against the entire staff when young William and Alice get their wish -- an adorable puppy.

title: An Old Flame
description: A lonely James has an affair with the very married Lady Newbury.

title: Disillusion
description: It's spring and Hudson's fancy wreaks havoc on the entire household.

title: Such a Lovely Man
description: Two bachelors pitch the woo to two ladies in the Bellamy household

title: The Nine Days Wonder
description: The entire household comes together when a General Strike is called throughout Britain in May 1926

title: The Understudy
description: On the eve of an important dinner party for a French diplomat, Hudson suffers a heart attack.

title: Alberto
description: Frederick considers his future when he feels his talents are largely wasted in the Bellamy household.

title: Will Ye No Come Back Again
description: Hudson is back in his element when the Bellamys travel to Scotland for their summer holiday.

title: Joke Over
description: After an evening of dissipated behavior and a reckless drive into the countryside, Georgina must appear at a coroner's inquest, when one of the locals is killed.

title: Noblesse Oblige
description: Better the devil you know than the one you don't is the lesson Mrs. Bridges and Ruby learn after a terrible row. Upstairs, Lord Stockbridge proposes to Georgina, but there's a catch.

title: All the King's Horses
description: James returns to England, with new found vigor and untold wealth, on the eve of the October 1929 stock market crash.

title: Whither Shall I Wander?
description: After nearly 30 years, the Bellamy saga ends with the sale of 165 Eaton Place and a fresh beginning for every member of the household.
